channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Loni Anderson, star of hit TV series 'WKRP in Cincinnati,' dies at 79
item.description: Loni Anderson died at a Los Angeles hospital following a prolonged illness, according to her longtime publicist, Cheryl J. Kagan.
item.content:encoded:
Loni Anderson died at a Los Angeles hospital following a prolonged illness, according to her longtime publicist, Cheryl J. Kagan.

(Image credit: Richard Shotwell/Invision)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: At least 68 African migrants killed after boat capsizes off Yemen coast, U.N. says
item.description: More than 150 Ethiopian migrants were on board the boat when it sank in the Gulf of Aden off the southern Yemeni province of Abyan, the International Organization for Migration in Yemen said.
item.content:encoded:
More than 150 Ethiopian migrants were on board the boat when it sank in the Gulf of Aden off the southern Yemeni province of Abyan, the International Organization for Migration in Yemen said.

(Image credit: AP Photo)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: More than 3,000 Boeing workers are set to strike after rejecting a contract offer
item.description: The International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers union members in Missouri and Illinois rejected a modified contract offered by Boeing last week.
item.content:encoded:
The International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers union members in Missouri and Illinois rejected a modified contract offered by Boeing last week.

(Image credit: Jason Redmond)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Russian volcano erupts days after monster quake shakes region
item.description: The volcano may have been primed to erupt before the magnitude 8.8 quake pushed it over the edge.
item.content:encoded:
The volcano may have been primed to erupt before the magnitude 8.8 quake pushed it over the edge.

(Image credit: Artem Sheldr)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: Trump's 'Golden Share' in U.S. Steel
item.description: The iconic American company, U.S. Steel was sold to Nippon Steel in Japan earlier this summer. The terms of the deal give President Trump an outsized say in the future of U.S. Steel.
item.content:encoded: The iconic American company, U.S. Steel was sold to Nippon Steel in Japan earlier this summer. The terms of the deal give President Trump an outsized say in the future of U.S. Steel.
item.dc:creator: Erika Beras

item.title: In 'Tested,' NPR's Embedded series takes a look at gender testing in sports
item.description: The series Tested from NPR's Embedded podcast and the C-B-C delved into the history of sex testing and what's considered "fair" in sports.
item.content:encoded: The series Tested from NPR's Embedded podcast and the C-B-C delved into the history of sex testing and what's considered "fair" in sports.
item.dc:creator: Mallory Yu

item.title: Canada wildfires cause poor air quality in the midwest and northeast U.S.
item.description: Health officials from Minnesota to Maine have issued alerts warning of poor air quality from wildfires burning in Canada. People are advised to limit outdoor exposure.
item.content:encoded:
Health officials from Minnesota to Maine have issued alerts warning of poor air quality from wildfires burning in Canada. People are advised to limit outdoor exposure.

(Image credit: Ashlee Rezin/AP)
item.dc:creator: Kristin Wright

item.title: Pope Leo tells 1 million Catholic youths they are sign 'different world is possible'
item.description: In his closing blessing for the Jubilee of Youth, Leo remembered the young people of Gaza and Ukraine and other countries "bloodied by war" who could not join their celebration.
item.content:encoded:
In his closing blessing for the Jubilee of Youth, Leo remembered the young people of Gaza and Ukraine and other countries "bloodied by war" who could not join their celebration.

(Image credit: Andrew Medichini)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Senate confirms ex-Fox News host Pirro as top federal prosecutor for nation's capital
item.description: The Senate confirmed ex-Fox News host Jeanine Pirro as top federal prosecutor for the nation's capital, after President Trump withdrew his controversial first pick, conservative activist Ed Martin Jr.
item.content:encoded:
The Senate confirmed ex-Fox News host Jeanine Pirro as top federal prosecutor for the nation's capital, after President Trump withdrew his controversial first pick, conservative activist Ed Martin Jr.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Morning cup of coffee getting too expensive? Try Yaupon
item.description: Tariffs on coffee and tea could give a boost to North America's only native caffeinated plant. NPR's Ayesha Rascoe talks with Abianne Falla, owner of CatSpring Yaupon.
item.content:encoded: Tariffs on coffee and tea could give a boost to North America's only native caffeinated plant. NPR's Ayesha Rascoe talks with Abianne Falla, owner of CatSpring Yaupon.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe
